CO 2 reduction for methanol prodction where the copper clusters served as an electron trap to reduce the recombination rate of photo exited electron-hole pairs 12.The (2 wt CuTiO 2 )SBA-15 catalyst exhibited a highest photocatalytic activity which was about 1.2 times as compared as unsupported 2 wt CuTiO 2 prepared by solgel synthesis and about 1.1 times higher than 45 wt TiO 2 SBA-15 without copper cocatalyst.It should be noticed that the optimum loading of Cu cocatalyst on TiO 2 SBA-15 composite

A series of mesoporous TiO 2 SBA-15, CuTiO 2 and CuTiO 2 SBA-15 composite photocatalysts were prepared by sol-gel synthesis for photoreduction of CO 2 with H 2 O to methanol.It was found that optimum amount of titanium loading of TiO 2 SBA-15 was 45 wt which exhibited higher photoreduction activity than pure TiO 2 .An addition of copper on TiO 2 or TiO 2 SBA-15 catalyst as cocatalyst was found to enhance the catalytic activity because copper serves as an electron trapper and prohibits the recombination of

The generation condition of the extraction is given: If Light_source is Solar or Solar Simulator, Lamp is always Solar Simulator.

evidence.pdf_reference: in the laboratory.The detail schematic drawing of the experimental set-up is shown in S1.The photocatalytic reaction system was equipped with a 400 W medium-pressure metal halide lamp (Phillps HPA400) with a peak light intensity at 365 nm mounted on an inner irradiation quartz cell.The photoreduction of CO 2 with water was performed in 550 ml aqueous 0.1 N NaOH solution containing about 0.05 g catalyst at 42 C.The initial pH value of 0.1 N NaOH solution was approximately pH 13.Then, CO 2 was bubbled

pH 13.Then, CO 2 was bubbled through the reactor for at least 30 min to purge air and to saturate the solution.The pH value of the CO 2 -saturated NaOH solution was nearly pH 7. To maintain CO 2 saturation during the reaction, CO 2 gas was bobbled into the reactor continuously, and the pH value of the solution was kept near pH 7 during the reaction.The gas product was analyzed by a gas chromatography (China Gas Chromatography 9800) with a packed column (Porapak, 3.5 m in length) and FID detector.
